title: Bug 12906 - Unable to open file in another editor if already opened in one editor
description: Bug 12906 - If a file is already opened in one editor, it should give an error message when trying to open it in another editor.
OB: When a file is opened in one editor, and then another attempt is made to open the same file in a different editor, nothing happens.
EB: When a file is already opened in one editor, and another attempt is made to open the same file in a different editor, a warning message should be displayed saying that opening the file in another editor may overwrite changes, and the user should be prompted to confirm if they want to proceed.
SR:
1. Make sure there is an associated Windows editor for Java files. If not, go to the file explorer, double-click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on a Java file, select 'Open With', and choose a system editor.
3. A Notepad or WordPad window will open with the Java file.
4. Close the opened file.
5. Go back to the Java Perspective and double-click on a Java file to open it in the workbench.
6. Right-click on the opened Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
7. Verify that a warning message is displayed, informing the user about the possibility of overwriting changes and prompting them to confirm if they want to proceed.
